intro: Cleistanthus diversifolius, commonly known as the variable-leaf cleistanthus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, including countries such as Thailand, Malaysia, and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its alternate, palmately lobed leaves that vary in shape and size, giving it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Cleistanthus diversifolius is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
